results.title: Politics: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: David Brownlow, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A brief history of politics in Russia prior to the Revolution in 1917, through the leadership of Lenin and Stalin, into the 1970’s. Identifies the Communist Party as the source of ultimate power and attempts to explain party organisation. Photography is by Dean Semler and narration by Margaret Throsby. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Brownlow, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: The People's music: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Contains eleven examples of Soviet citizens engaged in making music. Ranges from kindergarten children in Minst singing and dancing a traditional folk song to the highly respected professional group, the Kuban Cossack Choir and the Veryovka Folk Ensemble. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: Farming: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
Examines the Soviet agricultural system, the collective farms, or Kolkhoz, the State farms, or Sovkhoz and the importance of the agricultural private plot. Credits include: photography by Dean Semler; script by Roger Milliss; edited by Martyn Down; sound by Howard Spry and commentary by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: The Genesis of a dissident
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet Government and Politics”.
One of a series of films which make up a third level course from the Faculty of Social Science Open University. Offers an introduction to contemporary Soviet politics whilst simultaneously relating political practice to the historical development of the Soviet State and Marxist political theory. Presented by Victor Fainberg.

results.title: Bifo Kam
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
One of a series on the Solomon Islands, this film is concerned with the traditional culture of the Solomon Islands. It shows the construction of a canoe at Taumako, and the making of feather money which is used for dowry payments. Narrated by Alfred Aihunu; photography by Dean Semler. English commentary, Solomon Islands dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Araha Ana Romo
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
This documentary shows the bartering system, traditions and ceremonies on the Solomon Islands, particularly the ceremonies surrounding the election and inauguration of a new chief on one of the islands.

results.title: Nambo
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Australian Agency for International Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
Nambo is a large fruit grown in the Solomon Islands. Islanders are shown preparing and drying the fruits for local sale. Nambo is harvested from the forest, cut into pieces and dried and shipped to Honiara. Nambo is said to be more nutritious than biscuits. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Moro: Melanesian bigman
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
Moro and his people live on the island of Guadalcanal in the central Solomons. Some see him as a ‘cult leader’ and others ‘a confused power hungry man’. But to the people of the Solomon Island he is a real Melanesian Bigman who has rejected the use of modern technology. Cinematographer: Dean Semler. Narrated by Alfred Aihunu.
